Bash(#!/bin/bash
convert_symlinks() {
  local converted=0
  local failed=0
  
  find /Users/nick/.local/share/chezmoi -name "symlink_*" -type f | while read -r symlink_file; do
    # Read the target path from the symlink file
    target_path=$(cat "$symlink_file")
    
    # Skip if target doesn't exist
    if [[ ! -f "$target_path" ]]; then
      echo "SKIP: Target not found: $target_path"
      ((failed++))
      continue
    fi
    
    # Create new filename by removing 'symlink_' prefix
    new_file="${symlink_file/symlink_/}"
    
    # Copy content from target to new file
    if cp "$target_path" "$new_file"; then
      # Remove the old symlink file
      rm "$symlink_file"
      echo "✓ Converted: $(basename "$symlink_file") → $(basename "$new_file")"
      ((converted++))
    else
      echo "✗ Failed to convert: $symlink_file"
      ((failed++))
    fi
  done
  
  echo "Summary: $converted converted, $failed failed"
}

convert_symlinks)
